posts.name: Michelle
posts.cooked:
Weâ€™re releasing the Signal 7.50 beta soon. If youâ€™re interested in participating, join the beta group here.

Share your feedback on the latest changes:

We sped up the performance of scrolling in long chats. If you are in a big gardening group, now bloom scrolling is also vroom scrolling.

Also lots of work in prep for the Signal Backups Alpha.

Complete list of new commits since 7.49.1:
https://github.com/signalapp/Signal-Android/compare/v7.49.1â€¦main

Thank you for being a beta tester!

link_counts.title: Comparing v7.49.1...main Â· signalapp/Signal-Android Â· GitHub
Beta feedback for the upcoming Android 7.49 release

posts.cooked:
New Version: 7.50.0 (156400)

Builds will no longer be published to Firebase App Distribution

47 new commits since 7.49.1:

Show commits

  • Do not run subscription check if override is set. [1]

  • Preserve text when toggling view once. [2]

    Fixes an issue, where the written text would be lost if a user toggled view
    once in the AddMessageDialogFragment. This is unexpected, as when toggling
    view once from the MediaReviewFragment the previously written text is
    preserved.

  • Add verify key megaphone. [3]

  • Adjust turn on backups megaphone schedule. [4]

  • Wire in NetworkResult for Types. [5]

  • Change debug log from RecyclerView to WebView. [6]

  • Fix missing prompt to save PIN to password manager on Android < 14. [7]

    On Android versions older than 14, users were not prompted to save their PIN to their device password manager due to an autofill session conflict.
    The CreateSvrPinFragment.input field triggered an autofill session, so when ConfirmSvrPinFragment later attempted to save the PIN using CredentialManager, the system incorrectly assumed the credential had already been saved by autofill and skipped the save prompt.

  • Ensure we are restoring media per spec with full media and thumbnail rules. [8]

  • Add additional checks for serviceId during sending flow. [9]

  • Migrate ChangeNumberFragment to compose. [10]

  • Use libsignal for deriving thumbnail transit keys. [11]

  • Only enqueue attachment archive syncing jobs if the user backs up media. [12]

  • Select first backup subscription if selection is unavailable. [13]

  • Adjust domain scrubbing. [14]

  • Fix add 1000 messages copy/paste error during compose conversion. [15]

  • Prevent IMO retries when network unavailable. [16]

  • Remove internal-only crash during archive status reset. [17]

  • Improve reconciliation task to reduce possible churn. [18]

  • Fix rules for link+syncing expiring messages. [19]

  • Create search functionality for debug log page. [20]

  • Avoid uploading story-only media to backups. [21]

  • Fix backup message job cancel and start bugs. [22]

  • Fix missing chat folder crash. [23]

  • Add log lines for state refresh. [24]

  • Do not refresh on concurrent matching upload states. [25]

  • Update to RingRTC v2.55.0 [26]

  • Revert attempts to fix broken camera issue [27]

  • Inline long text attachments into backup files. [28]

  • Allow user to rotate AEP. [29]

  • Do not include view-once media in regular message backups. [30]

  • Generalize device authentication education sheet for backups. [31]

  • Exclude disappearing attachments from archive size estimation. [32]

  • Attempt to heal if we have everything we need but no entitlement. [33]

  • Truncate message length based on utf8-byte size. [34]

  • Improve conversation scroll performance. [35]

    Fixes a performance bottleneck in ConversationFragment caused by expensive calculations in ConversationItemDecorations.hasHeader(). This method is invoked in RecyclerView.ItemDecoration.getItemOffsets(), which runs on every layout pass and happens frequently during scrolling.
    The most expensive calculation in hasHeader() is toEpochDay(). That method calls Long.toLocalDate(), which clones a TimeZone object on each call. Upon opening one conversation (without scrolling), I observed that toEpochDay() was called over 1000 times in less than a second, rapidly allocating memory and causing garbage collection pressure that potentially leads to ANRs.
    We only need to calculate hasHeader() once for each conversation element, so caching the result of that method will eliminate the unnecessary calculations and improve the memory usage of ConversationFragment.

  • Update to MobileCoin enclave measurements. [36]

  • Don't show x on complete. [37]

  • Include backup size when fetching archive upload form. [38]

  • Add server message to group patch exception. [39]

  • Respect rate limit in send jobs. [40]

  • Filter messages that will expire within 24hrs from including attachments in backups. [41]

  • Increase log coverage for processing backup refresh and credential submission. [42]

  • Fix cut off linking text. [43]

  • Update how our check job handles mismatched tokens. [44]

  • Fix shadowed variable warning. [45]

  • Update translations and other static files. [46]

  • Bump version to 7.50.0 [47]

Gathered from signalapp/Signal-Android v7.49.1â€¦v7.50.0

Localization changes

Note: after clicking a link, it may take a few seconds before GitHub jumps to the file (try scrolling a bit if it doesnâ€™t).

Sticker took a long time to send.

Message ID

1753395507743

Log

https://debuglogs.org/android/7.50.0/1ed6c3d50d6ffa74630b78d8dfe687390b7279a55c1f0735f9927cb415bfbb0d

There was also a random jump up and back down the conversation after returning to the app. Not a fresh open from full close, but held in RAM/multitasking. That should be captured in the log.

New Version: 7.50.1 (156500)

Builds will no longer be published to Firebase App Distribution

5 new commits since 7.50.0:

  • Bump libsignal-client to v0.76.7 [1]

  • Migrate to new SVR2 enclave. [2]

  • Revert using WebView for debug log screen. [3]

  • Update translations and other static files. [4]

  • Bump version to 7.50.1 [5]

I sent a 750MB video to a friend assuming it would fail immediately. It did not . I donâ€™t think it was supposed to go through. When I played it after it finished sending, the compression had completely ruined the audio in the file. Let me know if I should provide you the file via cloud storage link in case thatâ€™ll be helpful. Itâ€™s an mkv format video.

Iâ€™m currently having trouble finding contacts. Neither by phone number, username, nor through discovery via the phone book is the saved contact recognized as a Signal contact. At the same time, I canâ€™t be found either. My QR code generates errors when scanned.

Beta testing for this release has concluded. If you find any further bugs related to this release or earlier releases, please report them on GitHub (read How to Report Bugs for more information on how to do that).

If you have feedback specifically related to the new beta version, please post it in the following topic: Beta Feedback for the upcoming Android 7.51 release.
